p: The SRH antibody titers of the 2645 serum samples analyzed are summarized in Figure 1 and Supplementary Table S1. Of these samples, 12.4% ( n = 328) were below 85 mm 2 (i.e., horses considered to be at risk of infection), including 190 samples with SRH antibody titer = 0 mm 2 and 138 seropositive samples (57.5 ± 17.4 mm 2). Of remaining samples, 27.3% were ≥85 mm 2 and <154 mm 2 (128.1 ± 19.1 mm 2; n = 721; i.e., horses considered as clinically protected) and 60.3% ≥ 154 mm 2 (194.8 ± 28 mm 2; n = 1596; i.e., horses considered as optimally immunised with clinical protection and little or no virus shedding in case of EIV infection). Overall, 87.6% of serum samples tested possessed SRH antibody titers above the clinical protection threshold (85 mm 2).
